metadata.titleEn: Water chemistry dataset Mazongshan area of Gansu province (2011-2012)
metadata.description: In August 2011 to October, 2012 in gansu province during may to August mazong mountain region field hydrogeological investigation, for each of groundwater, surface water outcropping points, according to the requirements of sampling, collecting water samples of 500 ml, sealed bottle, tag sampling time, location, number, send relevant qualification of laboratory tests, groundwater, surface water chemical analysis testing data obtained.Cations: Na+,K+,Mg2+,Ca2+, PH;Anions: F-,Cl-,NO3-,SO42-,HCO3-,CO32-;Trace elements, etc.In order to understand the chemical distribution of surface water and groundwater in the ma mane shan research area.
metadata.instructions:
File name: the data is stored in excel and doc format. The file names are "2011 trace element data. XLS", "2011 hydrochemical data. XLS", "2012 pH data. XLS", "2012 trace element data. XLS".
Data reading: remote sensing software such as Office and Wps can be used to open and read.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the key characteristics and components collected in a dataset focusing on water chemistry analysis in a specific region?
Feature Specification.Answer: collection of water samples, underground and surface water sources, cations like Na+, K+, Mg2+, Ca2+, pH levels, anions such as F-, Cl-, NO3-, SO42-, HCO3-, CO32-, trace elements, time, location, identification numbers

Definition.Question: What is involved in the data collection method for hydrochemical datasets in regions like Gansu Mazongshan?
Definition.Answer: The data collection method involves conducting field hydrogeological surveys to collect water samples from each groundwater and surface water outcrop point according to sampling requirements. Samples are collected in 500ml volumes, sealed, labeled with the sampling time, location, and identification number, and sent to qualified laboratories for testing. The data includes chemical analyses of cations (Na+, K+, Mg2+, Ca2+), anions (F-, Cl-, NO3-, SO42-, HCO3-, CO32-), pH, and trace elements to understand the distribution patterns of water chemistry in the study area.

Goal Orientation.Question: What are the primary objectives of collecting and analyzing water chemistry data in the Ma Zong Mountain area, and how does this contribute to understanding regional hydrological patterns?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The primary objective of collecting and analyzing water chemistry data in the Ma Zong Mountain area is to understand the distribution patterns of surface and groundwater chemistry. By obtaining data on cations such as Na+, K+, Mg2+, Ca2+, and anions such as F-, Cl-, NO3-, SO42-, HCO3-, CO32-, as well as trace elements, researchers aim to gain insights into the hydrological characteristics of the region. This information can be crucial for assessing water quality, understanding geochemical processes, and informing water resource management strategies in the Ma Zong Mountain research area.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What procedures are typically followed to collect and analyze water chemistry data from groundwater and surface water in a hydrological survey?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: During the hydrological survey conducted in the Ma Zong Mountain region, water samples were collected from each groundwater and surface water outcrop point. A 500ml water sample was taken according to sampling requirements, sealed, and labeled with the sampling time, location, and number. These samples were then sent to a qualified laboratory for chemical analysis to determine the concentrations of cations (Na+, K+, Mg2+, Ca2+), anions (F-, Cl-, NO3-, SO42-, HCO3-, CO32-), and trace elements. This approach helps understand the hydrochemical distribution patterns of surface and groundwater in the study area.
